results.title: The Twentieth Century: 1900-present
results.creator_credit: Joyce Fox, Matt Newman, Mary Watanabe, Janet Schloat, Educational Audio Visual and Clearvue
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History through art”.
The twentieth century has been a time of great change. Parts 1 and 2 of the program follow a chronological course of modern art through its different directions. The diversity of movements and their fleeting time frames are examined in this time line of the century of change and experimentation with form, reality, media and perception. The artists have been followed by musicians, photographers and film makers.

results.title: The Twentieth
results.brief_description: A record of the Twentieth Jazz Convention held in Sydney from December 26th to 31st, 1966. The main site of the convention was the Railways Institute but some bayside hotels, including the Coogee Bay Hotel, also became part of the scene. Includes some interesting shots of old inner Sydney streetscapes as well as the Opera House under construction. The first Jazz Convention was held in 1946 in Melbourne and features traditional jazz and blues music - 79 bands registered for this 20th convention. Performers included Graeme Bell, Nick Politis, Eric Richards, and the Original Australian Washboard Wackers. A must for lovers of jazz. Photography: Tom Cowan, Nigel Buesst.

results.title: The Twelve tasks of Asterix
results.creator_credit: Pierre Watrin, Albert Uderzo, Goscinny, Georges Dargaud, Idefix Studios and Dargaud Films
results.brief_description: In 50 BC Gaul is a quiet, peaceful place. Ceasar has recently subjected the country to a Roman invasion and renamed the place, France. Only a small pocket of Gauls remain; eponymous warrior Asterix, best friend Obelix and his canine companion Dogmatix, village chief, respected druid and creator of Asterix’s magic potion, Vitalstatistix, as well as Getafix and Cacofonix. When an army of Julius Ceasar’s guards attack the Gauls, they cannot believe the strength of their opponents and return to Caesar claiming they have come up against a group of gods. Caesar is not convinced however, and, inspired by the 12 deeds of Hercules, sets the Gauls 12 new tasks to prove their godliness and earn their freedom from Roman occupation, perhaps even take up a leadership position. The tasks include: footrace, the javelin, gladiator, Isle of Pleasure, the Eyes of Isis, eat it all, cave of the beast, form 838, the invisible high wire, answer the riddle, plain of the invisible spirits and the final task.

results.title: The Twelve months examination
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Child development series”
The child’s personality has developed to the point where he has begun to relate closely to members of the family and their friends. He realises that people and objects have separate existence apart from himself, and that they continue to exist when they are out of sight. The primitive motor reflexes have been replaced with definitive motor actions.

results.brief_description: Stills from the picture book illustrated by Robert Broomfield and accompanied by the music and song. Jennifer Brown sings the lyrics as the geese, swans, doves, drummers, pipers, dancing ladies and the partridge all appear on screen.

results.title: The Turning point
results.creator_credit: Herbert Ross, Arthur Laurents and Hera Productions
results.brief_description: Emma is an aging ballet star whose career has reached its peak. Deedee is her friend who abandoned her career many years ago for marriage and motherhood. The two are reunited when Deedee’s daughter shows real promise of becoming an outstanding ballerina. Stars Anne Bancroft and Shirley MacLaine with Tom Skerritt, Mikhail Baryshnikov, Leslie Browne, Martha Scott, Anthony Zerbe, supported by the American Ballet Theater and featuring the Los Angeles Philharmonic Orchestra.

results.title: The Turning
results.creator_credit: Ashlee Page, Ian Meadows, Yaron Lifschitz, Rhys Graham, Shaun Gladwell, Anthony Lucas, Maggie Miles, Justin Kurzel, Stephen Page, Jub Clerc, Claire McCarthy, Marieka Walsh, Robert Connolly, Mia Wasikowska, Tony Ayres, Warwick Thornton, Simon Stone, Jonathan auf der Heide, David Wenham, MIFF Premiere Fund, Screen Australia and Arenamedia
results.brief_description: Seventeen talented Australian directors from diverse artistic disciplines each create a chapter of the hauntingly beautiful novel by Tim Winton. The overlapping stories explore the turning points in people’s lives in a stunning portrait of a small coastal community.

constellations_other.name: Canopy
constellations_other.description: John Harvey is a Torres Strait Islander producer, director and writer in screen and stage whose work Canopy celebrates Indigenous self-representation.

constellations_other.name: Tony Ayres
constellations_other.description: Charts the acclaimed career of Tony Ayres through his work in film and TV.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ashlee Page, Ian Meadows, Yaron Lifschitz, Rhys Graham, Shaun Gladwell, Anthony Lucas, Maggie Miles, Justin Kurzel, Stephen Page, Jub Clerc, Claire McCarthy, Marieka Walsh, Robert Connolly, Mia Wasikowska, Tony Ayres, Warwick Thornton, Simon Stone, Jonathan auf der Heide, David Wenham, MIFF Premiere Fund, Screen Australia and Arenamedia
results.description: Seventeen talented Australian directors from diverse artistic disciplines each create a chapter of the hauntingly beautiful novel by multi award-winning author Tim Winton. The linking and overlapping stories explore the extraordinary turning points in ordinary people’s lives in a stunning portrait of a small coastal community. As characters face second thoughts and regret, relationships irretrievably alter, resolves are made or broken, and lives change direction forever.
description_for_label: Seventeen talented Australian directors from diverse artistic disciplines each create a chapter of the hauntingly beautiful novel by multi award-winning author Tim Winton. The linking and overlapping stories explore the extraordinary turning points in ordinary people’s lives in a stunning portrait of a small coastal community. As characters face second thoughts and regret, relationships irretrievably alter, resolves are made or broken, and lives change direction forever.

results.title: The Turn of the tide
results.creator_credit: Ian G Wallis and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description: Discusses the ecology of the shore of Westernport Bay, Victoria, and the effects on it of waterfront settlement and development and consequent water pollution. Shows research on the problem in progress.

results.title: The Turn of the screw
results.creator_credit: Ben Bolt, Martin Pope and Meridian Broadcasting
results.brief_description: This moody, atmospheric rendition of the Henry James novel stars Jodhi May as the governess entrusted with the care of two seemingly adorable children whom she suspects may be under the influence of supernatural powers. Rumours abound regarding the previous governess - Miss Jessel, who killed herself when she became pregnant to her master’s valet, Peter Quint, also now dead. Both Jessel and Quint begin appearing to the governess, who learns the children can see them too, particularly the boy. Unable to contact the orphaned children’s guardian (Colin Firth) due to a clause in her contract which prohibits any contact, the young governess must face the unknown alone if she is to save the soul of the children. Cast also includes Pam Ferris, Joe Sowerbutts and Grace Robinson.
